overview:
## Return Value

An instance or subclass of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableRowView]. If `nil` is returned, an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableRowView] instance will be created and used.

## Discussion

The delegate can implement this method to return a custom [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableRowView] for `row`.

The reuse queue can be used in the same way as documented in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableViewDelegate/tableView(_:viewFor:row:)]. The returned view will have attributes properly set to it before it’s added to the `tableView`.

# tableView(_:rowViewForRow:)

**Instance Method**

Asks the delegate for a view to display the specified row.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func tableView(_ tableView: NSTableView, rowViewForRow row: Int) -> NSTableRowView?
```

## Parameters

- **tableView**: The table view that sent the message.
- **row**: The row index.

## Return Value

An instance or subclass of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableRowView]. If `nil` is returned, an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableRowView] instance will be created and used.

## Discussion

The delegate can implement this method to return a custom [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableRowView] for `row`.

The reuse queue can be used in the same way as documented in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableViewDelegate/tableView(_:viewFor:row:)]. The returned view will have attributes properly set to it before it’s added to the `tableView`.



## Providing views for rows and columns

- **tableView(_:viewFor:row:)**: Asks the delegate for a view to display the specified row and column.
